p.s: I saw your e-mail in which you wanted to know what KLS goes green was about.
I want to inform you about this project.
Two years ago our school decided to do more than 40 workshops in one day which deal with environmental protection.
The students had a high political and social interest, as you could see at the demonstration Fridays for Future, where many of our students took part.
The topic environmental / climate protection played a huge role at the school concilcouncil.
With the topic KLS goes green students, teachers and parents needed to give ideas for workshops.
In this way students won't lose interest in climate change, because they think they cannot do something against climate change.
Our ideas were varriedvaried for example food sharing, less use of water, second-hand markets with used clothes and in general a sustainable daily lifestyle.
Our students also searched for ideas for our schoolkiosk which are biological and fairtrade.
In addition to this our students sold vegan waffels which wherewere made with sustainable food.
We also had lessons for our pronunciation to discuss about climate topics more self-confident.
All in all the students were very motivated and liked it a lot.
In the future we will do another organization like this.
You can also come if you want to.
